m.v_0: Click sign in button after entering your ID and password.

m.v_1: ID should contain 5~20 english letters or numbers.
m.v_3: Password should contain 8~20 English letters, numbers, or special characters.

m.p_0: Search by chart number or name

m.i_2: Overall score of adequacy and repeatability
m.i_3: If each digit satisfies explained condition, each is displayed as 1 or 0.

p.dr_0: Normal : When the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is 70% or higher, and the mid-expiratory flow rate (FEF25-75%) is 70% or higher.
p.dr_1: Obstructive : When the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is 70% or higher, but the mid-expiratory flow rate (FEF25-75%) is less than 70%.
p.dr_2: Restricted : When FEV1% is 70% or higher, but the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is less than 80%.
p.dr_3: Obstructive Mild : Mild obstructive ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and the 1-second forced expiratory volume (FEV1) rate is greater than 70%.
p.dr_4: Obstructive Abnormal : Moderate obstructive ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and the 1-second forced expiratory volume (FEV1) rate is 60-70%.
p.dr_5: Obstructive Moderate : Moderate obstructive ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and the 1-second forced expiratory volume (FEV1) rate is 50-59%.
p.dr_6: Obstructive Severe : Severe obstructive ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and the 1-second forced expiratory volume (FEV1) rate is 35-49%.
p.dr_7: Obstructive Very Severe : Very severe obstructive ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and the 1-second forced expiratory volume (FEV1) rate is less than 35%.
p.dr_8: Mixed : Mixed ventilatory impairment when the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is less than 80%, and FEV1% is less than 70%.
p.dr_9: Asthma Suspected : When the forced vital capacity (FVC) rate is 80% or higher, FEV1% is less than 70%, and there is a difference of 12% or more in FVC when compared with post-results (showing a pattern of restrictive lung disease, but positive for asthma when compared with post-test results).
p.ec_0: Indicates whether the reproducibility of FVC is satisfied among the appropriate measurements.
p.ec_1: Indicates whether the reproducibility of FEV1 is satisfied among the appropriate measurements.
p.ec_2: Indicates whether the reproducibility of PEF is satisfied among the appropriate measurements.
p.ec_3: Indicates whether the conditions for extrapolated volume (Vext) of the representative measurement are satisfied. Should be less than 5% or 150ml compared to FVC.
p.ec_4: Indicates whether the conditions for the high-pitched portion (PFT) of the representative measurement are satisfied. PEF should be reached within 0.12 seconds.
p.ec_5: Indicates whether the conditions for expiratory time (FET) of the representative measurement are satisfied. There must be a clear expiration record for at least 1 second.
p.ml_0: Suitable for examination with three or more appropriate measurements, demonstrating excellent reproducibility in FVC, FEV1, and PEF. The values are interpretable for pulmonary function.
p.ml_1: Suitable for examination with three or more appropriate measurements, demonstrating good reproducibility in FVC, FEV1, and PEF. The values are interpretable for pulmonary function.
p.ml_2: Suitable for examination with two or more appropriate measurements, demonstrating fair reproducibility in FVC, FEV1, and PEF. Caution is needed in the interpretation of pulmonary function.
p.ml_3: Suitable for examination with one or more appropriate measurements, demonstrating fair reproducibility in FVC, FEV1, and PEF, or calculations are not possible. Not suitable for interpreting pulmonary function.
p.ml_4: No appropriate measurements are available, making reproducibility calculations impossible. Not suitable for interpreting pulmonary function.
